analyzed: 沙門大廣智不空奉　詔譯
translated: Tripiṭaka Master of the Great Expansive Wisdom, Śramaṇa Amoghavajra, Specially Advanced, Probationary Chief Minister for Making Loud Announcements at the Daxingshan Temple, Translated by Imperial Order
If there are practitioners who uphold this mantra,

original: 或能乞食或專喫乳粥或能自食。
analyzed: 或能乞食或專喫乳粥或能自食。
translated: Whether they beg for food or eat milk porridge exclusively, or eat by themselves,

original: 當於像前持誦滿三十萬遍。
analyzed: 當於像前持誦滿三十萬遍。
translated: They should recite in front of the image until they reach 300,000 times.
Then perform the fire ritual.
Take yūma and make 1,080 pieces.
Recite once and throw one piece into the fire to burn.
Three times a day for 40 days.
It is said that all that is sought will be accomplished.

original: 又取玉柔和安悉香作丸。
analyzed: 又取玉柔和安悉香作丸。
translated: Also, take yūma and asafoetida and make pills.

original: 從黑月八日起首終十四日。
analyzed: 從黑月八日起首終十四日。
translated: Start from the eighth day of the dark half of the month until the fourteenth day.

original: 日別三時時別誦一千八遍。
analyzed: 日別三時時別誦一千八遍。
translated: Recite 1,008 times each time, three times a day.
Throw the previous pills into the fire.
The celestial youth, either during the day or at night,

original: 必來現身而為伴侶滿一切願。
analyzed: 必來現身而為伴侶滿一切願。
translated: Will definitely come and manifest his body to be their companion, fulfilling all wishes.
They can be used as they wish, and nothing will not be accomplished.
Also, take ankusha incense and make it into pills.
For seven days, three times a day,
each time reciting one thousand and eight times.
Recite once and throw one pill into the fire each time.
You will surely become the lord of a town and nothing will not be accomplished.
When the practitioner wishes to perform this method,
he should first recite it 700,000 times.
The method of making the image.
The image uses white sandalwood wood,
six fingers long, made in the shape of a youth.

original: 左手把菓右手垂作滿願掌向外。
analyzed: 左手把菓右手垂作滿願掌向外。
translated: The left hand holds fruit, the right hand hangs down in the gesture of fulfilling wishes, facing outward.
Place it in the ritual arena.

original: 作種種飲食乳粥香花供養。
analyzed: 作種種飲食乳粥香花供養。
translated: Make various kinds of food, milk porridge, incense and flowers, and make offerings.
Take red flowers.

original: 每花一誦一擲童子身上。
analyzed: 每花一誦一擲童子身上。
translated: Recite once for each flower and throw it onto the youth's body.

original: 滿十萬遍其童子必來現身。
analyzed: 滿十萬遍其童子必來現身。
translated: When it reaches 100,000 times, the youth will definitely come and appear in person.
You will then be able to fulfill all wishes.

original: 日施千人上妙衣食無所闕乏。
analyzed: 日施千人上妙衣食無所闕乏。
translated: Daily give a thousand people the finest clothes and food, without anything lacking.
Also, every day, three times,

original: 時別取蘇合香作一千八丸。
analyzed: 時別取蘇合香作一千八丸。
translated: each time take a thousand and eight pills of frankincense.
After seven days have passed in the fire,
The young boy will appear in person to point out the hidden treasures.

original: 若能日日受持獲大利益示其寶藏。
analyzed: 若能日日受持獲大利益示其寶藏。
translated: If one can uphold this daily, one will obtain great benefits and he will show one the treasure store.
And it is the same for the cave of the asuras.

original: 指授必滿其願得大財寶。
analyzed: 指授必滿其願得大財寶。
translated: Pointing out will surely fulfill one's wishes and one will obtain great wealth and treasures.
If a person is bound,
If one recites this mantra, one will be liberated.

original: 又法欲令一切人見即歡喜。
analyzed: 又法欲令一切人見即歡喜。
translated: Moreover, the method for causing all people to see and be delighted is as follows:

original: 稱彼人名誦滿十萬遍即皆歡喜。
analyzed: 稱彼人名誦滿十萬遍即皆歡喜。
translated: Recite this mantra ten thousand times while calling the person's name, and they will all be delighted.
Furthermore, take wood from a tree that is not withered.
Burn it on top of a high mountain peak.

original: 和安悉香作一千八丸擲火中。
analyzed: 和安悉香作一千八丸擲火中。
translated: Mix it with asafetida and make one thousand and eight pills, throwing them into the fire.

original: 即得安穩成就欲令見即見壽命千歲。
analyzed: 即得安穩成就欲令見即見壽命千歲。
translated: One will then attain peace and accomplishment. If one wishes to see, one will see, and one's lifespan will be one thousand years.
The dhāraṇī mantra states:

original: 􇩂唵􄓜㨖􄙘苾部必反􄓜㨖􄖫儞􅁥娑嚩􄚩訶又一本云。
analyzed: 􇩂唵􄓜㨖􄙘苾部必反􄓜㨖􄖫儞􅁥娑嚩􄚩訶又一本云。
translated: Oṃ ṭiṭṭi ṭiṭṭi ni svāhā. Another version says:

original: 􇩂唵􄓜㨖􄒶惹􄓜㨖􄖫儞􅁥娑嚩􄚩訶其根本契者。
analyzed: 􇩂唵􄓜㨖􄒶惹􄓜㨖􄖫儞􅁥娑嚩􄚩訶其根本契者。
translated: Oṃ jīvita jīvita ni svāhā. The fundamental mudrā is as follows:
The two hands form the añjali gesture.

original: 若召請時以禪智三度來去。
analyzed: 若召請時以禪智三度來去。
translated: When summoning, use the three fingers of meditation and wisdom to come and go.

original: 若發遣時外撥三度。🔽請火天明契　真言曰。
analyzed: 若發遣時外撥三度。 請火天明契　真言曰。
translated: When dismissing, flick the three fingers outward.🔽The mudrā and mantra for inviting the fire god are as follows:🔽Oṃ agneya agne agni svāhā. The mantra for dismissal is:

original: 􇩂唵􆿅阿􅍉祁那􄗷曳􆿅阿􄑘蘖􆿅􄑘阿蘖􅁥莎􄚩訶發遣明曰。🔽􆿅阿􅍉祁那􄗷曳􄑘蘖􇩹車􄑘􇩹蘖車􅁥莎􄚩訶其契相者。
analyzed: 􇩂唵􆿅阿􅍉祁那􄗷曳􆿅阿􄑘蘖􆿅􄑘阿蘖􅁥莎􄚩訶發遣明曰。 􆿅阿􅍉祁那􄗷曳􄑘蘖􇩹車􄑘􇩹蘖車􅁥莎􄚩訶其契相者。
translated: Agneya agne ni carā ni carā svāhā. The mudrā is as follows:
The right hand curls the thumb into the palm.
The index finger is bent like a hook.
It supports the back of the thumb at the lower joint.

original: 餘並舒之。🔽召請時但以頭指三招。
analyzed: 餘並舒之。 召請時但以頭指三招。
translated: The rest are extended.🔽When summoning, simply beckon three times with the index finger.

original: 若發遣時外撥三度即是。
analyzed: 若發遣時外撥三度即是。
translated: When dismissing, flick the three fingers outward three times.
The mudrā and mantra for protecting the body are as follows:

original: 􇩂唵􄥏俱嚕􄕻馱􄖩曩􆿁𤙖􄓁惹其契者以右手作拳。
analyzed: 􇩂唵􄥏俱嚕􄕻馱􄖩曩􆿁𤙖􄓁惹其契者以右手作拳。
translated: Oṃ kuru tvaṃ nāṃ hūṃ jaḥ. The mudrā practitioner makes a fist with the right hand.

original: 竪大指觸身五處即未然護。
analyzed: 竪大指觸身五處即未然護。
translated: Raising the thumb, touch the five places of the body, and immediately it becomes protection.

original: 氷揭羅天童子經保延三年七月二十三日於仲川之寫了一校了承安四年甲午十二月二十日以三本交合傳受玄證本也
analyzed: 氷揭羅天童子經保延三年七月二十三日於仲川之寫了一校了承安四年甲午十二月二十日以三本交合傳受玄證本也
translated: The Sūtra of the Heavenly Youth Bhīmagarjita. On the twenty-third day of the seventh month in the third year of Bao Yan, it was copied at Zhongchuan. It was proofread in the twelfth month on the twentieth day of the fourth year of Jiawu in the Yongzheng era. It is the Xuanzheng edition, which was collated and transmitted from three copies.
